title: 108_s864
content: The "National Guard and Reserves Child Care Relief Act" authorizes appropriations for child care assistance for military dependents under the Child Care and Development Block Grant Act of 1990. $10,000,000 is authorized for each fiscal year from 2004 to 2008 for this purpose. The Secretary will provide grants to eligible persons for child care services for dependents by eligible providers. A dependent is defined as an individual meeting specific criteria, and an eligible person is a parent of a dependent who is a member of a reserve component on active duty for more than 30 days in support of a military operation. The provision allows for grants to be provided for child care services for dependents of Armed Forces members on active duty for military operations, who have primary responsibility for the care of their dependents and reside at least 50 miles from military installations with child care facilities. The Department of Defense provides child care facilities for dependents of members on active duty for military operations like Operation Enduring Freedom, Operation Iraqi Freedom, and Operation Noble Eagle. To be eligible for a grant, applicants must submit an application to the Secretary with required information, including details about eligible child care. To be eligible for a grant under this section, applicants must submit an application to the Secretary with required information, including details about the eligible child care provider. The provisions of this subchapter, excluding section 658P, do not apply to assistance provided under this section. SEC. 4. CONFORMING AMENDMENTS. Section 658O of the Child Care and Development Block Grant Act of 1990 is amended to specify changes in the allocation of funds under different sections.
